description.narrative:
Contribution to the Asia Pacific Observatory for Health Systems and Policies (APO) to support objectives established in the APO work-plan including publication of country health system reviews, preparation of comparative country studies and the development of policy briefs on high priority health issues in the Indo-Pacific region.
APO is a WHO hosted regional partnership of governments, international agencies, foundations and researchers. It works closely with leading regional research hubs to provide and promote systematic and scientific analysis of health systems in the Indo-Pacific region, and encourage the use of evidence by the region’s decision makers. Its goal is to support policy makers to develop health systems that contribute to improved health outcomes and that are equitable, efficient, responsive and transparent.
The total value of this investment is $0.5 million to be expensed in the 2018-19 financial year.
